title: 109_hr3649
content:
The Act titled "Sportfishing and Recreational Boating Safety Amendments Act of 2005" amends the Sportfishing and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2005 by specifying the effective date of amendments. The amendments made by the Sportfishing and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2005 will take effect on October 1, 2005. Existing laws will be preserved temporarily until the end of fiscal year 2005, except for those amended by title II of the Act. Section 10143 of the Sportfishing and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2005 is amended to update references to the Dingell-Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act. This includes adjustments to funding amounts and specific subsections within the Act. In Section 10143 of the Sportfishing and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2005, funding amounts are updated by increasing the amount from $5,000,000 to $5,500,000 and specifying a minimum of $2,000,000. Additionally, the word "unexpected" is changed to "unexpended" in paragraph (5). SEC. 103. Amends Section 10119 of the Sportfishing and Recreational Boating Safety Act of 2005 regarding the expenditure of remaining balance in the Boat Safety Account. TITLE II--EXTENSION OF RECREATIONAL BOATING FUNDING THROUGH THE END OF FISCAL YEAR 2005

SEC. 201. NATIONAL OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATIONS PROGRAM FUNDING: Amends the Dingell-Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act to allocate $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2005.

SEC. 202. CLEAN VESSEL ACT FUNDING: Amends the Dingell-Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act to adjust funding amounts for the Clean Vessel Act for fiscal year 2005.

SEC. 203. COAST GUARD EXPENSES: Addresses Coast Guard expenses. SEC. 203. COAST GUARD EXPENSES: Amends title 46, United States Code to increase funding for Coast Guard expenses. SEC. 302. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to change the date and title references related to the Boat Safety Account. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act. For fiscal year 2005, obligation authority for funds under title I of Public Law 108-447 for the Secretary of Transportation's traffic and highway safety functions shall be equal to the funds provided. Additional obligation authority required will be taken from other programs funded by the same law. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
